episode.title: PR #5164: Feature/cross legal entity inventory lookup
episode.description: Pull Request by yufei-huang: Feature/cross legal entity inventory lookup. 2 files changed, +155 -0 lines. Branch: feature/cross-legal-entity-inventory-lookup -> main.

script.speaker: Alex
script.text: Hey everyone, welcome back to PRCast. Today we’re looking at MicrosoftDocs/dynamics-365-unified-operations-public pull request number 5164, titled Feature/cross legal entity inventory lookup.

script.speaker: Alex
script.text: This one is a documentation-focused PR, but it’s actually pretty impactful for Commerce teams running multi-company operations. The author adds a new article for enabling cross-company inventory lookup in Dynamics 365 Commerce POS, plus a TOC update so the guide is discoverable in the inventory availability section.

script.speaker: Alex
script.text: At a high level, the feature allows store associates to see inventory across legal entities. In real-world terms, that means if inventory is owned in one company but sold by another, the associate can still check availability across the network and guide the customer better.

script.speaker: Alex
script.text: The new doc is thorough. It covers prerequisites like Commerce version 10.0.47 or later, Inventory Visibility Service integration, and API version 2.0. It also explains feature enablement in Feature Management, fulfillment group setup with cross-entity warehouses, and required distribution schedules like 1070 and 1110.

script.speaker: Alex
script.text: What I like here is the practical framing. The write-up explains current limitations clearly—visibility is available, but cross-company order fulfillment selection in POS is still not there yet. That kind of honest boundary setting prevents bad assumptions during rollout.

script.speaker: Alex
script.text: Change size is moderate for docs: 2 files changed, plus 155 and minus 0. The substance is concentrated in one new how-to article, which is exactly what you want for maintainability.

script.speaker: Alex
script.text: No major review discussion happened on this PR, which usually means scope was clear and execution matched expectations.

script.speaker: Alex
script.text: Bottom line: this is a solid documentation addition for a feature that can materially improve in-store service in multi-entity retail orgs. If your team has been handling cross-company inventory through workaround knowledge, this guide gives you an official, structured implementation path.

script.speaker: Alex
script.text: That’s it for this episode. Thanks for listening to PRCast, and I’ll catch you in the next pull request breakdown.
